alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 27 at 6:28PM HST until January 27 at 10:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Maui in Maui County * Until 1000 PM HST. * At 628 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over the slopes of Haleakala. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing. The Honopou Stream and other streams remains elevated. Although rainfall has eased over other parts of Maui, runoff remains high. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kahului, Kihei, Kula, Keokea, Pukalani, Makawao, Haliimaile, Keanae, Huelo, Kipahulu, Haiku-Pauwela, Kaupo, Nahiku, Ulupalakua, Wailea, Pauwela, Paia, Makena, Puunene and Maalaea. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1000 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
